items.preText:
3.30 pm India are oin their huddle. Over on the other side, Bangladesh's openers are walking out to the pitch

. Bhuvneshwar Kumar to take the new ball. One wide slip for him. Bangladesh's top order will be facing a stern test with Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Jasprit Bumrah returning to their usual best against Pakistan. First-innings totals in the UAE have largely been in the region of 250 - and they've often been more than enough. That requires one of the top four to play a long(ish) innings and for the team to not over-reach. Right then, time for the national anthems.

3.10 pm Mushfiqur Rahim was rested from the last Bangladesh game - a dead rubber - because he is the biggest batting asset they have. And that's only because he puts himself through the most gruelling training. For more on that, here is Mohammad Isam.

There can be no other reason for India bowling first besides their eagerness to unleash their secret weapon - Kedar Jadhav. The one-time specialist batsman has become India's go-to bowler to keep runs down in the middle overs with his low-arm action and total lack of pace. But how did all of this come about? Well, cause MS Dhoni had a masterstroke.

India: 1 Rohit Sharma (capt), 2 Shikhar Dhawan, 3 Ambati Rayudu, 4 Dinesh Karthik, 5 MS Dhoni (wk), 6 Kedar Jadhav, 7 Ravindra Jadeja, 8 Bhuvneshwar Kumar, 9 Kuldeep Yadav, 10 Jasprit Bumrah, 11 Yuzvendra Chahal

Bangladesh: 1 Liton Das, 2 Nazmul Hossain, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mohammad Mithun, 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Mosaddek Hossain, 8 Mehidy Hasan, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Rubel Hossain, 11 Mustafizur Rahman

Mohammad Isam has found out that "This will only be the second time Tamim will miss an ODI against India since his debut in 2007."

Mainul: "I wonder why Bangladesh keeps playing an all rounder who's not really doing anything good in any segment of the game! i.e Mosaddek! He is not really that much effective with ball, been on a run drought for a long time! So why dont we just play an extra batsmen like mominul or someone else instead! Clearly All of BDs' trouble begins with batting! If you need a back up bowler you can always go to Mahmudullah who is not that bad! Does pretty good in BPL so far in my opinion! so why mosaddek? :/"

Snehil: "Rohit is just doing what he said, to not chop and change and give the guys a longer run. Maybe that's why KL is missing out. Don't be surprised if KL doesn't get a chance in the tournament."

Arnav Pabby: "Rahul has test tons in England and Australia, Manish Pandey scored a brilliant ton to win India an ODI in Australia. For ages, India lacked batsmen who could perform overseas, and now when they've finally been blessed with some, they don't play them. Pandey's omission is perhaps understandable in that he hasn't done himself too many favours since that knock. But Rahul's OBVIOUS TALENT and recent runs, it's a bit ridiculous that they keep leaving him out. "

Mrigank: "How is Rayadu over KL Rahul logical or futuristic? Do the selectors seriously see Rayadu making the cut for WC 19? Rahul has scored runs in all formats of the game and needs to be become a regular - this dropping -coming back can't be good for his confidence or form. Similarly DK over Pant when Pant is the obvious future choice to replace MSD and perhaps travel to WC as a backup keeper."

3.00 pm India have won the toss and they'll bowl first."Played a few games here and it gets better to bat under lights and we like to chase," Rohit Sharma says. "That's been the team's strength. The pitches are similar to India. One change. Ravindra jadeja comes in for the injured Hardik Pandya"

"Would have liked to bat anyway," says Mashrafe Mortaza. "Sometimes it's good after a bad game you don't have to think much. Today is an important match, first game of the Super Fours. Mushfiqur comes in and so does Mustafizur. Mominul misses out and so does Abu Hider"

2.55 pm The toss is in five minutes - just enough time for a speed read of Saurabh Somani's preview of what has become a very engaging rivalry.

A little inside information from Shashank Kishore at the ground: Ravindra Jadeja in an engaging chat with L Sivaramakrishnan as he prepares to bowl at the nets. Wonder which language they were speaking in. Hindi isn't Siva's forte, Jadeja doesn't prefer English. Unique combination, but as they say, cricket is a language in itself. Dinesh Karthik continues to train as a wicketkeeper, just in case he's needed at some stage in the tournament there's a possibility Jadeja will slot in straightaway. The only other change India could contemplate now that they have a second spinner with Kuldeep is Khaleel in place of a slightly off-colour Yuzi Chahal. Manish Pandey is the only one taking boundary line catches, training for the kind of catch he took the other day to dismiss Sarfraz Ahmed

Chirag Pathak : "How come Kartik get selected ahead of Rahul in previous 2 matches ? Can anyone give genuine reason please!" Might be because the team believes Rahul is better batting higher up the order and that there are no places available there. But Karthik's a pretty useful finisher with his unorthodox shots

Vyshakh Pillai: "Because Rahul got a fair chance before. Now its Dinesh Karthik's turn. I guess if he fails, Rahul will slot back in. "

2.45 pm Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's ball-by-ball coverage of the Asia Cup game between India and Bangladesh. There has been a great deal of attention - we even made a video - on the schedule of this tournament, which has most teams shuttling between Abu Dhabi and Dubai, and yet Rohit Sharma and his men have had the luxury of staying put and avoiding travel. Would that come out as a major advantage, especially considering Mashrafe Mortaza and his team played a game yesterday in Abu Dhabi and are now back in action again in Dubai?

Zeeshan: "I don't really think it's going to be a major advantage for India considering the fact that the travel time is less than a couple of hours. I think playing back to back game will be tough for Bangladesh because of the weather. I think that the organizers should have given a day off between the two stages of the tournament. "

ASA: "Let us hope we can go past the scheduling controversy fast and focus on the game!"

Ganesh Janakira: "the scheduling does seem very unfair, for that matter havinf ODIs back to back in itself is a blunder and the unnecessary travelling for other nations has made things worse. "
items.text: finds the outside edge right away. Short of good length, excellent seam position as it straightens just outside the off stump channel. Liton fails to get on top of the bounce entirely

items.text: just back of a length, slanted across, blocked off the backfoot

items.text: angles a length ball across his off-stump, Nazmul plays late through backward point

items.text: full on middle, pushed to mid-on
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: "Only 2 pace options? Might have dropped a leg spinner to bring some one like Kaul or Chahar," feels Shankar
items.text: short outside off, left alone, and called a wide though it seemed to be well inside

items.text: fullish length around off, pushed between cover and extra cover for a quick one
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off, gets on top of the bounce and defends
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, no run

items.text: good length outside off, works it towards midwicket with the angle

items.text: swings early on a pull and gets hit on the right shoulder as the ball lobs towards short third man

items.shortText: Bumrah to Najmul Hossain Shanto, no run

items.preText: Don: "I dont think only 2 pacers is gonna be a problem... Yesterday we saw Bangladesh choke to spinners ...Just might be Indian thinking during selection"
items.text: fullish outside off, pushes early at it and luckily the ball drops well short of cover
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, no run

items.text: short of a length, cuts in off the deck, opens the face to third man
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, 1 run

items.preText: Prasanna: "I don't know about you guys but I am so excited to see Jadeja back in the ODI side. Not sure why he was dropped in the first place. "
items.text: good length on middle and leg, defended back
items.shortText: Kumar to Najmul Hossain Shanto, no run

items.text: full, angled across around a fifth-stump channel, pushed down the pitch
items.shortText: Kumar to Najmul Hossain Shanto, no run

items.text: advances down to a length ball and doesn't time his pull too well, mid-on runs to his left a few steps and stops it
items.shortText: Kumar to Najmul Hossain Shanto, 1 run

items.text: walks down again and telegraphs it, Bhuvneshwar drags the length back and he lets it go
items.shortText: Kumar to Liton Das, no run

items.text: pushes across a full toss that's driven out through extra cover, Rohit sprints behind the ball and keeps it inside
items.shortText: Bumrah to Najmul Hossain Shanto, 3 runs

items.text: ripper, lands perfectly on the seam and shoots up off a back of a length to square him up and leave him beaten
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, no run

items.text: short of a length on off, defended
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, no run

items.text: short outside off, gets the room he needs to pull it mightily through midwicket
items.shortText: Bumrah to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.preText: Sudhir: "Yaay!! Sir Jadeja is back. The world seems a different place altogether!!"
items.text: short of good length on off, defended to point

items.text: good length on off, blocked to cover
